content:
EventLogRecord Class

In this Article

Contains the properties of an event instance for an event that is received from an EventLogReader object. The event properties provide information about the event such as the name of the computer where the event was logged and the time that the event was created.

Syntax

Declaration

public class EventLogRecord : System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventRecord

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventRecord
  • EventLogRecord

Inherited Members

Dispose()
,
Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Properties summary

ActivityId

Gets the globally unique identifier (GUID) for the activity in process for which the event is involved. This allows consumers to group related activities.
Bookmark

Gets a placeholder (bookmark) that corresponds to this event. This can be used as a placeholder in a stream of events.
ContainerLog

Gets the name of the event log or the event log file in which the event is stored.
Id

Gets the identifier for this event. All events with this identifier value represent the same type of event.
Keywords

Gets the keyword mask of the event. Get the value of the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogRecord.KeywordsDisplayNames* property to get the name of the keywords used in this mask.
KeywordsDisplayNames

Gets the display names of the keywords used in the keyword mask for this event.
Level

Gets the level of the event. The level signifies the severity of the event. For the name of the level, get the value of the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogRecord.LevelDisplayName* property.
LevelDisplayName

Gets the display name of the level for this event.
LogName

Gets the name of the event log where this event is logged.
MachineName

Gets the name of the computer on which this event was logged.
MatchedQueryIds

Gets a list of query identifiers that this event matches. This event matches a query if the query would return this event.
Opcode

Gets the opcode of the event. The opcode defines a numeric value that identifies the activity or a point within an activity that the application was performing when it raised the event. For the name of the opcode, get the value of the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogRecord.OpcodeDisplayName* property.
OpcodeDisplayName

Gets the display name of the opcode for this event.
ProcessId

Gets the process identifier for the event provider that logged this event.
Properties

Gets the user-supplied properties of the event.
ProviderId

Gets the globally unique identifier (GUID) of the event provider that published this event.
ProviderName

Gets the name of the event provider that published this event.
Qualifiers

Gets qualifier numbers that are used for event identification.
RecordId

Gets the event record identifier of the event in the log.
RelatedActivityId

Gets a globally unique identifier (GUID) for a related activity in a process for which an event is involved.
Task

Gets a task identifier for a portion of an application or a component that publishes an event. A task is a 16-bit value with 16 top values reserved. This type allows any value between 0x0000 and 0xffef to be used. For the name of the task, get the value of the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogRecord.TaskDisplayName* property.
TaskDisplayName

Gets the display name of the task for the event.
ThreadId

Gets the thread identifier for the thread that the event provider is running in.
TimeCreated

Gets the time, in DateTime format, that the event was created.
UserId

Gets the security descriptor of the user whose context is used to publish the event.
Version

Gets the version number for the event.

Methods summary

Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged resources used by this object, and optionally releases the managed resources.
FormatDescription()

Gets the event message in the current locale.
FormatDescription(IEnumerable<Object>)

Gets the event message, replacing variables in the message with the specified values.
GetPropertyValues(EventLogPropertySelector)

Gets the enumeration of the values of the user-supplied event properties, or the results of XPath-based data if the event has XML representation.
ToXml()

Gets the XML representation of the event. All of the event properties are represented in the event's XML. The XML conforms to the event schema.

Properties

  • ActivityId

    Gets the globally unique identifier (GUID) for the activity in process for which the event is involved. This allows consumers to group related activities.

    public override Nullable<Guid> ActivityId { get; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Guid>

      Returns a GUID value.

  • Bookmark

    Gets a placeholder (bookmark) that corresponds to this event. This can be used as a placeholder in a stream of events.

    public override System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventBookmark Bookmark { get; }

    Property Value

    • EventBookmark

      Returns a EventBookmark object.

  • ContainerLog

    Gets the name of the event log or the event log file in which the event is stored.

    public string ContainerLog { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns a string that contains the name of the event log or the event log file in which the event is stored.

  • Id

    Gets the identifier for this event. All events with this identifier value represent the same type of event.

    public override int Id { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      Returns an integer value. This value can be null.

  • Keywords

    Gets the keyword mask of the event. Get the value of the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogRecord.KeywordsDisplayNames* property to get the name of the keywords used in this mask.

    public override Nullable<long> Keywords { get; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>

      Returns a long value. This value can be null.

    Remarks

    The keywords for an event are used to group the event with other similar events based on the usage of the events. Each keyword is a bit in a 64-bit mask. Predefined bit values and reserved bits occupy the top 16 positions of this mask, leaving the manifest to use any bits between 0x0000000000000001 and 0x0000800000000000.

    The standard event keywords are defined in the StandardEventKeywords enumeration.

  • KeywordsDisplayNames

    Gets the display names of the keywords used in the keyword mask for this event.

    public override System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> KeywordsDisplayNames { get; }

    Property Value

    • IEnumerable<String>

      Returns an enumerable collection of strings that contain the display names of the keywords used in the keyword mask for this event.

    Remarks

    The standard event keywords are defined in the StandardEventKeywords enumeration.

  • Level

    Gets the level of the event. The level signifies the severity of the event. For the name of the level, get the value of the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogRecord.LevelDisplayName* property.

    public override Nullable<byte> Level { get; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Byte>

      Returns a byte value. This value can be null.

    Remarks

    The standard event levels are defined in the StandardEventLevel enumeration.

  • LevelDisplayName

    Gets the display name of the level for this event.

    public override string LevelDisplayName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns a string that contains the display name of the level for this event.

    Remarks

    The standard event levels are defined in the StandardEventLevel enumeration.

  • LogName

    Gets the name of the event log where this event is logged.

    public override string LogName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns a string that contains a name of the event log that contains this event.

  • MachineName

    Gets the name of the computer on which this event was logged.

    public override string MachineName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns a string that contains the name of the computer on which this event was logged.

  • MatchedQueryIds

    Gets a list of query identifiers that this event matches. This event matches a query if the query would return this event.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<int> MatchedQueryIds { get; }

    Property Value

    • IEnumerable<Int32>

      Returns an enumerable collection of integer values.

  • Opcode

    Gets the opcode of the event. The opcode defines a numeric value that identifies the activity or a point within an activity that the application was performing when it raised the event. For the name of the opcode, get the value of the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogRecord.OpcodeDisplayName* property.

    public override Nullable<short> Opcode { get; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int16>

      Returns a short value. This value can be null.

    Remarks

    The standard event opcodes are defined in the StandardEventOpcode enumeration.

  • OpcodeDisplayName

    Gets the display name of the opcode for this event.

    public override string OpcodeDisplayName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns a string that contains the display name of the opcode for this event.

    Remarks

    The standard event opcodes are defined in the StandardEventOpcode enumeration.

  • ProcessId

    Gets the process identifier for the event provider that logged this event.

    public override Nullable<int> ProcessId { get; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int32>

      Returns an integer value. This value can be null.

  • Properties

    Gets the user-supplied properties of the event.

    public override System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventProperty> Properties { get; }

    Property Value

    • IList<EventProperty>

      Returns a list of EventProperty objects.

  • ProviderId

    Gets the globally unique identifier (GUID) of the event provider that published this event.

    public override Nullable<Guid> ProviderId { get; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Guid>

      Returns a GUID value. This value can be null.

  • ProviderName

    Gets the name of the event provider that published this event.

    public override string ProviderName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns a string that contains the name of the event provider that published this event.

  • Qualifiers

    Gets qualifier numbers that are used for event identification.

    public override Nullable<int> Qualifiers { get; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int32>

      Returns an integer value. This value can be null.

  • RecordId

    Gets the event record identifier of the event in the log.

    public override Nullable<long> RecordId { get; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>

      Returns a long value. This value can be null.

  • RelatedActivityId

    Gets a globally unique identifier (GUID) for a related activity in a process for which an event is involved.

    public override Nullable<Guid> RelatedActivityId { get; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Guid>

      Returns a GUID value. This value can be null.

    Remarks

    An event provider can set the value of the ActivityID attribute before publishing events. All the events that are published after this ID is set will have the ActivityID attribute set to the specified value. This allows providers to specify simple relationships between events. The events that are published are part of the same activity. When a provider must start a new, but related activity, the publisher can publish a transfer event and specify the new activity ID. This new ID will appear as a RelatedActivityID attribute. This allows consumers to group related activities.

  • Task

    Gets a task identifier for a portion of an application or a component that publishes an event. A task is a 16-bit value with 16 top values reserved. This type allows any value between 0x0000 and 0xffef to be used. For the name of the task, get the value of the stem.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogRecord.TaskDisplayName* property.

    public override Nullable<int> Task { get; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int32>

      Returns an integer value. This value can be null.

    Remarks

    The standard event tasks are defined in the StandardEventTask enumeration.

  • TaskDisplayName

    Gets the display name of the task for the event.

    public override string TaskDisplayName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns a string that contains the display name of the task for the event.

    Remarks

    The standard event tasks are defined in the StandardEventTask enumeration.

  • ThreadId

    Gets the thread identifier for the thread that the event provider is running in.

    public override Nullable<int> ThreadId { get; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int32>

      Returns an integer value. This value can be null.

  • TimeCreated

    Gets the time, in DateTime format, that the event was created.

    public override Nullable<DateTime> TimeCreated { get; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<DateTime>

      Returns a DateTime value. The value can be null.

  • UserId

    Gets the security descriptor of the user whose context is used to publish the event.

    public override System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier UserId { get; }

    Property Value

    • SecurityIdentifier

      Returns a SecurityIdentifier value.

  • Version

    Gets the version number for the event.

    public override Nullable<byte> Version { get; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Byte>

      Returns a byte value. This value can be null.

Methods

  • Dispose(Boolean)

    Releases the unmanaged resources used by this object, and optionally releases the managed resources.

    protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);

    Parameters

    • disposing
      Boolean

      true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

  • FormatDescription()

    Gets the event message in the current locale.

    public override string FormatDescription ();

    Returns

    • String

      Returns a string that contains the event message in the current locale.

  • FormatDescription(IEnumerable<Object>)

    Gets the event message, replacing variables in the message with the specified values.

    public override string FormatDescription (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<object> values);

    Parameters

    • values
      IEnumerable<Object>

      The values used to replace variables in the event message. Variables are represented by %n, where n is a number.

    Returns

    • String

      Returns a string that contains the event message in the current locale.

  • GetPropertyValues(EventLogPropertySelector)

    Gets the enumeration of the values of the user-supplied event properties, or the results of XPath-based data if the event has XML representation.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IList<object> GetPropertyValues (System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogPropertySelector propertySelector);

    Parameters

    • propertySelector
      EventLogPropertySelector

      Selects the property values to return.

    Returns

    • IList<Object>

      Returns a list of objects.

  • ToXml()

    Gets the XML representation of the event. All of the event properties are represented in the event's XML. The XML conforms to the event schema.

    public override string ToXml ();

    Returns

    • String

      Returns a string that contains the XML representation of the event.
